DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that records the history of specific breast characteristics.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Some matter, situation, or event that is thought about, written about, or discussed._One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest._Characteristics; distinguishing qualities of a person, object, or substance._Clinical manifestations that can be either objective when observed by a physician, or subjective when perceived by the patient.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Some matter, situation, or event that is thought about, written about, or discussed.

Concepts.definition: Some matter, situation, or event that is thought about, written about, or discussed.

Property.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.:Characteristics; distinguishing qualities of a person, object, or substance.:Clinical manifestations that can be either objective when observed by a physician, or subjective when perceived by the patient.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.
The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.
Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The words that describe the history of specific breast characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

Concepts.definition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An infectious process affecting the breast.

Concepts.definition: Inflammation of breast tissue during lactation or postpartum due to an obstructed duct or infection.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having high relative density or specific gravity; permitting little if any light to pass through.: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

Concepts.definition: Having high relative density or specific gravity; permitting little if any light to pass through.
One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Dilatation of the mammary duct without atypical cells.

Concepts.definition: Dilatation of the lumen of the mammary ducts without evidence of epithelial atypia.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the breast.: A usually neoplastic transformation of the cell, associated with altered architectural tissue patterns.  The cellular changes include nuclear and cytoplasmic abnormalities.  Molecular genetic abnormalities are also often found and, in some instances, may lead to cancer. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: Having to do with the breast.

A usually neoplastic transformation of the cell, associated with altered architectural tissue patterns. The cellular changes include nuclear and cytoplasmic abnormalities. Molecular genetic abnormalities are also often found and, in some instances, may lead to cancer.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.:Characteristics; distinguishing qualities of a person, object, or substance.:The aggregate of past events; the continuum of events occurring in succession leading from the past to the present; a record or narrative description of past events.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.
The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.
The aggregate of past events; the continuum of events occurring in succession leading from the past to the present; a record or narrative description of past events.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
